alert.note: Alert for Morehouse (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:01AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chicot, Ashley Counties in southeastern Arkansas and northwestern Morehouse Parishes through 845 AM CDT... At 801 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Fountain Hill to 6 miles north of West Crossett to near Lapile. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... North Crossett and Old Milo around 810 AM CDT. Snyder around 815 AM CDT. Hamburg around 820 AM CDT. Portland and Montrose around 825 AM CDT. Crossett around 830 AM CDT. Lake Village and Mcmillan Corner around 840 AM CDT. Berlin around 845 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Blanchton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
